summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between Bureau of Prisons staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on July 26, 2019. The emails discuss the need to assess inmate Jeffrey Epstein before an attorney visit, a debate about his psychological observation status, and administrative matters like award nominations. It reveals internal prison communications and concerns about Epstein's mental state shortly before his death.

keyFacts: On July 26, 2019, Bureau of Prisons staff were coordinating to assess Jeffrey Epstein before a scheduled attorney visit.
A Central Office Psychologist had expressed concern that Epstein had been stepped down from suicide watch (SW) to psychological observation (psych obs).
The Chief Psychologist, Ian, defended the decision but intended to reassess Epstein that morning to ensure it was still appropriate.
The emails show internal administrative communication and procedural concerns regarding a high-profile inmate just weeks before his death.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) document set related to the Epstein case.
